title: How Many Calories Do You Burn in a Sauna?
meta_description: Discover how many calories do you burn in a sauna during a typical 30-minute session, plus factors affecting burn rate, equivalents, and tips for accuracy.
h1: How Many Calories Do You Burn in a Sauna?
assumptions: Average 70 kg adult in a dry sauna at 80°C; passive sitting; burn rate based on elevated heart rate and mild activity equivalent.
disclaimer: Calorie burn varies by body weight, sauna temperature, humidity, duration, hydration, and individual metabolism. Consult a professional for personalized estimates.

quick_answer.text: A 30-minute sauna session burns about 150 calories for an average adult.

label_note: Values represent energy expenditure; other fields are not applicable to calorie burn and are set to zero for schema consistency.

tweaks.label: Steam sauna (higher humidity, slightly more effort)

faqs.q: How many calories do you burn in a sauna per hour?
faqs.a: About 300 calories for an average adult in a 60-minute session.

faqs.q: Does sauna burn more calories than resting?
faqs.a: Yes, roughly 1.5–2 times the resting rate due to heat stress and mild cardiovascular elevation.

faqs.q: How does body weight affect calories burned in a sauna?
faqs.a: Heavier individuals burn more; e.g., add ~30% for 90 kg vs. 70 kg.

faqs.q: Is sauna calorie burn like exercise?
faqs.a: It's milder, similar to light activity; not a substitute for workouts but aids recovery.

faqs.q: What factors increase calories burned in a sauna?
faqs.a: Higher temperature, longer duration, movement, or dehydration can slightly increase the rate.
